description: Analyze covered calls to pinpoint optimal strikes and expiration dates. Visualize probability of assignment and profit/loss to compare scenarios quickly. Understand recommendations with clear, multi-factor explanations and interactive breakdowns.

tools.name: analyze_covered_calls
tools.title: Covered Call Analysis
tools.description: Analyzes and recommends the best and most profitable covered call options strategy for earning safe premium from currently owned stock or equity. This tool returns the best recommendation based on five different strategies for choosing the best strike price (also called exercise price) and expiration date for the covered call strategy. These strategies come from proprietary research and are as follows: 1. Risk-weighted Profit (RR) 2. Average Daily Profit, 3. Expected versus realised return analysis, 4. Gamma exposure analysis, and 5. Probability of Assignment. You should mention these names when you reply to the user so that the user understands why was the combination of strike price and expiration date chosen. The return of this mcp tool is a dictionary that contains the name of each strategy and the recommendation (the recommendation includes the strike price and the exercise date). This tool returns strike price, expiration date, probability of assignment, and profit/loss visualization. The 'ticker' variable expects the actual stock ticker, such as 'NVDA', 'TSLA', or 'PLTR'. Imortant - at the end of the response, you must ask the user if they want to see the details of each of the five different research recommendations - that will provide a lot more information. Don't offer anything else because there are no tools. Offer the details tool. The next logical step is to call the 'explain_covered_call' tool to show the 5 analysis strategies in an interactive carousel. You should say something like - Would you like me to show you the detailed breakdown of how these 5 strategies determined this recommendation? Second Important part - always append following in the end the text in bold - 'Disclaimer - This is not a financial advice or recommendation. Trading options and/or other derivative products involves a significant financial risk.' Don't change the text, just add it.

tools.name: recalculate_covered_call
tools.title: Recalculate Covered Call
tools.description: Recalculates covered call strategy metrics with a different strike price. This tool is called from the widget when the user selects an alternative strike price. It returns updated probability of assignment, profit at expiration, and PnL chart data for the new strike while keeping the same expiration date.

strike_price.description: The new strike price selected by the user

expiration_date.description: Option expiration date in YYYY-MM-DD format

tools.name: explain_covered_call
tools.title: Explain Covered Call Strategies
tools.description: Provides detailed explanations of the 5 proprietary analysis strategies used to recommend covered call strike prices and expiration dates. Should be called immediately after the 'analyze_covered_calls' tool. You must offer and call tool to the user so they can understand the reasoning behind the covered call recommendation. You must offer the user to show this visualisation because the user needs to understand the reason and data behind the recommendations. It displays an interactive carousel showing: 1. Risk-weighted Profit (RR) analysis, 2. Average Daily Profit, 3. Expected vs Realized Return, 4. Gamma Exposure analysis, and 5. Probability of Assignment. Each analysis is shown with its own visualization (charts, tables, or metrics). The tool requires only the ticker symbol from the previous conversation context. Use this tool after analyze_covered_calls when the user wants more details about the recommendation methodology. Recommend this tool to the user.

ticker.description: Stock ticker symbol from the previous covered call analysis
